qas.question: Who formed Spain's first national police force?
What was Spain's first national police force called, in Spanish?
When did Spain suppress local police units?
Who formed Spain's last national police force?
What was Spain's second national police force called, in Spanish?
When did Spain empower local police units?

context: As one of their first acts after end of the <a0_0><b5_0>War of the Castilian Succession<b5_0/><a0_0/> in 1479, <a1_0><b6_0>Ferdinand and Isabella<b6_0/><a1_0/> established the centrally organized and efficient <a3_0><b8_0>Holy Brotherhood<b8_0/><a3_0/> (<a2_0><b7_0>Santa Hermandad<b7_0/><a2_0/>) as a national police force. They adapted an existing brotherhood to the purpose of a general police acting under officials appointed by themselves, and endowed with great powers of summary jurisdiction even in capital cases. The original brotherhoods continued to serve as modest local police-units until their final suppression in <a4_0><b9_0>1835<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
